title: High-Pedigree Lawyers Lead Sides in Immigration Battle - WSJ
text:
High-Pedigree Lawyers Lead Sides in Immigration Battle Noel Francisco and Noah Purcell have at least one thing in common: sterling legal pedigrees Feb. 6, 2017 8:13 p.m. ET 
The lawyers tussling over the legality of President Donald Trumpâ€™s executive order on immigration have at least one thing in common: sterling legal pedigrees. 
Noel Francisco, acting U.S. Solicitor General, is leading the fight for the administration. He joined the Justice Department last month from law firm Jones Day, which handled electoral-law work for Mr. Trump during his campaign.
